page.title: 10Developments in farming
page.content: David Watson of Moulton Lodge Farm anticipates that future developments will reflect the current demand for food containing more{protein}to replace that with a high animal fat content. He intends to increase pea and lupin production and grow less wheat.Another {experimental crop,}Evening Primrose, is being considered to help replace the{soya bean}imports from America and Australia. {Mechanisation}of farming implements is becoming increasingly important to efficient production. At present the farm employs three tractors, one telescopic loader, four trailers, one drill, one combine harvester and a range of cultivating equipment. The farm's own{workshop}is now capable of carrying out 95 per cent of all necessary repairs and maintenance.
